pageContext.description: Length of rivets 5mm. There is no ornament or grooving, nor does it thicken perceptibly in the centre. The point of the blade has been broken off since the published illustrations were made; the middle rivet is missing, but the other two are preserved. The outline of the hilt can be traced, and it appears to have been mounted approximately at right angles, for use as a halberd.
pageContext.associations: Found at a depth of five feet, lying immediately on a heap of half-burnt human bones.
pageContext.publications: Journ. Brit. Arch Ass., X, (1855), 164, fig. 2.,Hillier, History of Isle of Wight, pt. i, p. 7. fig. 1.
pageContext.site: England,Isle of Wight,Ashey,In barrow 5 on Ashey Down
pageContext.toSearch: Ashey, Ryde, Isle Of Wight Po33, UK
